DataElement.preferredName: Resected Tissue Gross Pathological Examination Positive Finding Outcome Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether the gross appearance of disease was observed in the tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Resected Tissue Gross Pathological Examination Positive Finding Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having been removed by surgery._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease._A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Resected; having been removed by surgery.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Property.preferredName: Gross Pathological Examination Positive Finding Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease.:A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
